ya estoy en la isla del elefante, ¿qué sigue?
vale, voy al oeste donde veo la jirafa
vale, sigo al sureste hasta llegar a la serpiente
¡vale! camino dos pasos al este y

chat.msg: hey, q tal? empezamos el juego?
genial! veamos, estás frente al perro blanco, ¿verdad? primero, quiero que camines un poco hacia la izquierda, justo debajo de ese banco de madera que ves
luego, cruza un sendero hacia lo que parece ser un puesto de flores. no te preocupes, no vamos hasta allá
una vez que estés cerca, quiero que hagas un u-turn poquito rápido hacia la izquierda, cruces el sendero de nuevo y vuelvas hacia donde el primer perro blanco está descansando
¡perfecto! ahora, cruza el camino que hay frente al perro y continúa caminando hacia el sur, no muy lejos hay otro perro blanco junto a un mantel de picnic a cuadros rojo y blanco
sigamos, ahora pasa por encima del mantel, roza ese tazón de moras que ves allí, y luego continúa hacia el oeste
laughs* cuidado con las moras! ahora, vas a ver una rama de madera que cruza el río, avanzas y la atraviesas hacia el norte
bien hecho! cuando estés al otro lado del río, vas a ver un arbusto verde
pero no lo toques, mejor dale la vuelta por el lado derecho hasta llegar al puesto de flores
ahora giras a la izquierda, pasas por debajo del puesto de flores y llegarás a un gran puente
hay un par de personas en bicicleta allí, pero tu solo sigue pasando el puente hacia el oeste
justo después del puente, te encontrarás con un par de ancianos disfrutando de su lectura
desde ahí, te mueves hacia el sur, entre el banco de los viejitos y otra rama de madera hasta que llegues a un arbusto verde que está junto al final de esa rama de madera
ahora toma un ligero giro al este, entre la rama y el arbusto
solo un par de pasos más
¡perfecto! ¿ves ese ciervo joven de color marrón que está a unas pocas pasos de ti?
sólo debes caminar hasta él. ¡felicidades, lo has hecho estupendamente!

chat.msg: hi there! que comience el juego!!
cool! let's start with the three palm trees you're near. duck under the first tree and head towards the second tree
make a right and then a sharp left before you reach tree number three. got it?
great! now walk straight down. soon, you'll see a cute brown puppy
be sure to sway a little to your left but not too much. after that, steer a bit to the right. doing fine?
sweet! spot those two rocks ahead? navigate between them
there's a big one to your left and a small one to your right. the ocean is right there too! exciting right?
awesome! time for a little swim
enter the water and you'll find a big red crab. practically neighbors now! go right, keeping close to the big rock on your side
look! there's another rock ahead, medium-sized
keep going until you spot a shark - scary, i know! then make a sharp right turn
pew! back on land now! you are going to cross between that medium rock and a tri-color ball there
nice work! you're gonna see a red tent on your left and a big speaker on your right soon
play it cool! gently veer to your left, crossing between them
alright, now stay north-west and arc around the tent nicely
awesome! now, let's head south towards the beach, but stop short of the water
fab! got that red kayak in sight? turns right and slip under it
you’re rocking this! now turn right, walk along that kayak until you spot a small green bush
fantastic! you've made it to the bush
you rocked it! thanks for playing along
you made it to the end, high five buddy!

general_survey.answer: Yes, I came to the United States when I was 6 years old and have been here ever since that's why English is my second language
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: I think they mix languages because some words don't exist in the other language.
